messages.message:
I would say from a user that has never seen ib before, im curious on how they would know what their username is in this context. Should we consider making the fs abstract away the username itself? To confirm, i looked all over and cannot find where the username would be present. Thoughts here
https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/docs/aihub/apis/run-apps-api/index.html#uploading-files-to-an-input-folder
I think this is the question you asked in your previous message: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0516UPPMT3/p1696363843659389
To folks who do need to make API calls, we surfaced this username at the top of the API token page because the API documentation refers to usernames.
Ah that makes sense now on how we create usernames based email domains.
Im still wondering if we want to make the fs/api simpler. Do we have plans to expose fs app out itself in commercial?

not yet in scope. There is still some part of a file-explorer that will be visible (e.g. the file-picker when you need to select files) and eventually we will provide a trimmed down view of a file-explorer that will only expose files that users will care about (e.g. input and output files).
Can you select files if you dont have an external drive?
For community, there’s Google Drive. For commercial there’s only Google Drive right now, but S3 + Azure Blob are coming soon.

We should consider how we can abstract the username away from API calls though. If a user is always using their username in the fs path, can we consider filling it in the backend and simplifying the API usage?
